quiz.title: Solving One-Variable Equations (Quiz 7)
quiz.subtitle: Section 2.6: Mixed Equation Types (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Identifying and Solving All Equation Types

questions.question: Solve: 3x + 7 = 2x + 12
questions.explanation: Subtract 2x: x + 7 = 12. Subtract 7: x = 5. Regular one-solution equation.

questions.question: What type of equation is 4(x - 2) = 4x - 8?
questions.explanation: Distribute: 4x - 8 = 4x - 8. Variables cancel, true statement remains. Identity with infinite solutions.

questions.question: Solve: 5x - 3 = 2(x + 6)
questions.explanation: Distribute: 5x - 3 = 2x + 12. Subtract 2x: 3x - 3 = 12. Add 3: 3x = 15. Divide by 3: x = 5.

questions.question: Which equation has no solution?
questions.explanation: 3x - 1 = 3x + 4 simplifies to -1 = 4 (false). A and D are identities, C has solution x = 4.

questions.question: Solve: 0.5x + 3 = 1.5x - 1
questions.explanation: Subtract 0.5x: 3 = x - 1. Add 1: x = 4. Decimal equation with one solution.

questions.question: What is true about 2(x + 3) - 5 = 2x + 1?
questions.explanation: Left side: 2x + 6 - 5 = 2x + 1. So 2x + 1 = 2x + 1. Identity with infinite solutions.

questions.question: Solve: (x/3) + 2 = (2x/3) - 1
questions.explanation: Multiply by 3: x + 6 = 2x - 3. Subtract x: 6 = x - 3. Add 3: x = 9.

questions.question: Which equation results in 5 = 5 when solved?
questions.explanation: 2(x+3)-1 = 2x+6-1 = 2x+5. So 2x+5 = 2x+5 → 5=5. Identity. A and C give false statements, D gives x=4.

questions.question: Solve: 7 - 3x = 3(1 - x) + 4
questions.explanation: Right side: 3(1-x)+4 = 3-3x+4 = 7-3x. So 7-3x = 7-3x → 0=0. Identity with infinite solutions.

questions.question: Find x: 2x + 8 = 4(x - 1)
questions.explanation: Right side: 4x - 4. So 2x + 8 = 4x - 4. Subtract 2x: 8 = 2x - 4. Add 4: 12 = 2x. Divide by 2: x = 6.
